entry.title: Reddit Just Dropped Thousands More NFTs on Polygon From Over 100 Artists
entry.summary: After minting more than 10.6 million Polygon NFTs, Reddit is launching a huge Gen 3 collection today. Artists tell Decrypt what to expect.

entry.title: Gaming Hardware Giant Razer Launches Web3 Incubator
entry.summary: The major hardware and peripherals brand is funding Web3 games through a new Web3 incubator within its venture arm.

entry.title: Borrowing Against NFTs Is Now a $1 Billion Industry—What’s Next?
entry.summary: Since volumes for borrowing against NFTs crossed the $1 billion mark, many are left wondering: Who’s using their jpeg as collateral in this market?

entry.title: ‘Sandwich the Ripper’ MEV Exploiter Joins Tether’s Graveyard of Blacklisted Addresses
entry.summary: Another address has been blacklisted by stablecoin provider Tether, bringing its total of banned addresses to 865.

entry.title: CleanSpark Doubles Bitcoin Mining Fleet With $145M Deal
entry.summary: CleanSpark's $144.9 million deal with Bitmain will double its fleet's total operational mining capacity by the end of the year.

entry.title: How Do You Stake Cryptocurrencies? Earning Passive Income With Crypto
entry.summary: Proof-of-stake networks like Ethereum will reward you with crypto for staking your coins. Here’s how that works.

entry.title: MiCA: What Europe’s New Crypto Rules Mean for the Industry
entry.summary: The European Union will soon usher in a suite of new crypto rules called MiCA. But what are they and what does it mean for the industry?

entry.title: MicroStrategy's Bitcoin Bet Now in Profit Amid Latest Rally
entry.summary: As the price of Bitcoin recaptures $30,000, MicroStrategy's bold investment in the largest cryptocurrency appears to be paying off.

entry.title: Solana Leads Crypto Market Rebound, Jumps 10% Overnight
entry.summary: SOL is riding the positive sentiment across the crypto market and the excitement around its Android phone launch.

entry.title: Proof Launches Exclusive NFT Collection for Moonbirds Holders
entry.summary: The collection will feature 10,000 pieces from 22 artists, including Beeple.

entry.title: Bitcoin Hits $30,000, Reaching 10-Month High
entry.summary: Bitcoin is surging—up 9% in the last week—and the crypto market is following suit.

entry.title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Joins Ron DeSantis in Railing Against CBDCs
entry.summary: The two potential candidates in the 2024 election have criticized central bank digital currencies as tools for financial surveillance.

entry.title: 'Dogumentary' Film to Chronicle Rise of Meme That Inspired Dogecoin
entry.summary: The feature-length film, produced by PleasrDAO and Own the Doge, hopes to attract a major Hollywood studio or backer.

entry.title: AI Kryptonite: Why Artificial Intelligence Can't Handle Hands
entry.summary: ...or teeth, or toes, or abs. Yet.

entry.title: FTX CEO Slams Exchange for Keeping Private Keys on Amazon Web Services
entry.summary: FTX “kept virtually all crypto assets in hot wallets," CEO John Ray III, who's overseeing the company's restructuring, wrote in a report.

entry.title: How the Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade Could Impact the Price of ETH
entry.summary: More than 18 million ETH—worth roughly $34 billion—is set to unlock after Shanghai. Here's what analysts are expecting.

entry.title: Coinbase Chief Legal Officer: The Problem With SEC's Howey Test Isn't Its Age
entry.summary: Coinbase Chief Legal Officer Paul Grewal discussed the "Howey Test," which the SEC uses as its yard stick for whether a crypto asset should be regulated as a security, and told Decrypt's Stacy Elliott and Dan Roberts the issue with it isn't that it's old (the case is from 1946) but how it's being applied to modern technology. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Every Crypto Project Must Reckon With the SEC's Howey Test
entry.summary: Gary Gensler's SEC won't roll out new rules for crypto because the agency believes the Howey Test is perfectly sufficient for assessing tokens.

entry.title: Hackers Rob South Korean Exchange of $13M in Bitcoin, Ethereum, Other Assets
entry.summary: South Korean cryptocurrency exchange GDAC has reported it lost nearly a quarter of its assets due to a hacking attack.

entry.title: FTX Debtors Say 'Hubris, Incompetence, and Greed' at Root of Exchange's Collapse
entry.summary: The latest update on the FTX estate reveals a series of “unusual obstacles” due to the firm’s lack of “appropriate record keeping.”

entry.title: Bitcoin Miners Will Have Same Rights as Data Centers, Says New Arkansas Bill
entry.summary: Should it pass, the bill states that discrimination against crypto mining businesses would be prohibited in Arkansas.

entry.title: Bitcoin’s Energy Transparency Is a Double-Edged Sword: Hut 8 Mining CEO
entry.summary: Although it gets a lot of negative attention, Bitcoin’s power usage also creates accountability, says Jaime Leverton.

entry.title: SushiSwap Smart Contract Bug Exploited in $3.3 Million Theft
entry.summary: The decentralized exchange says it's "all hands on deck" and that some of the funds have been recovered.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Musk Goes Full Dogecoin, Pumping the Memecoin
entry.summary: CoinFLEX co-founder Mark Lamb tweeted a bizarre letter to his alleged debtors and a candidate for U.S. president 2024 spread serious misinformation.

entry.title: Midjourney Uses Photo Uploads To Help You Craft Prompts
entry.summary: The new upload feature takes the guesswork out of the creative art process.

entry.title: And the Winner of Metaverse Fashion Week 2023 Is...
entry.summary: Last week’s event plummeted in attendance from 2022. But it may have offered clues towards a path forward for brands in the virtual realm.

entry.title: Decentralized Pictures Plots Its Next Web3 Grant for Filmmakers
entry.summary: Leo Matchett from Web3 film funding platform Decentralized Pictures tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA about DCP's just announced iPhone Filmmaking Initiative, which will support aspiring filmmakers who create a short film on their iPhones, and will be determined via DCP's crypto-native on-chain voting system.

entry.title: Thai Man Uses AI To Win Lottery
entry.summary: It only earned him $60, but he still gets his five minutes of fame. Was it good luck or science?

entry.title: 3 Ways DAO Treasuries Will Hit $100B in Balances
entry.summary: With DAO treasuries hitting a cumulative $25 billion recently, the next question is: How long until they reach $100 billion?

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin and Ethereum Unmoved, Musk Makes Dogecoin Noise
entry.summary: Despite a relatively uneventful week in coin markets, several big crypto adoption stories hit the press.

entry.title: Give Your Bitcoin to the Poor, Salvadoran Economist Urges Nayib Bukele
entry.summary: El Salvador President Nayib Bukele’s Bitcoin bet is not popular with everyone in the country.

entry.title: Craig Wright Hints Apple May Be Violating Copyright by Storing Bitcoin White Paper
entry.summary: The Australian computer scientist who claims to have created Bitcoin suggests he might get litigious with one of the biggest tech companies on the planet.

entry.title: Staked Ethereum Withdrawals Could Take Weeks After Shanghai Upgrade: Analyst
entry.summary: Ethereum's next big upgrade will enable withdrawals of staked ETH, but heavy demand could drag out the process.

entry.title: ChatGPT Wrongly Accuses Law Professor of Sexual Assault
entry.summary: The chatbot says a prominent law professor committed sexual assault during a trip he never took.

entry.title: Push Protocol Launches Privacy-Focused ChatGPT Clone
entry.summary: The Web3 project uses Metamask and other wallets to create an encrypted chatbot.

entry.title: SBI Crypto Sues Riot Blockchain-Owned Data Center for Fraud, Negligence
entry.summary: SBI Crypto alleges that Riot-owned data center Whinstone fraudulently misrepresented its capacity to host large-scale mining operations.

entry.title: North Korea's ‘Malicious Cyber Activities’ Deeply Concerning, Say US, Japan, South Korea: Report
entry.summary: High-level diplomats have urged the global community to ensure the repatriation of all North Korean nationals working abroad.

entry.title: Which Crypto Transactions Are NOT Taxable? How To Minimize Your Crypto Taxes
entry.summary: Doing your crypto taxes can be a lot less stressful if you know how to minimize your tax burden.

entry.title: Web3 YouTuber CryptoStache: Gaming Will Be the Catalyst That Takes NFTs Mainstream
entry.summary: Web3 gaming YouTuber CryptoStache talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA about why Web3 gaming will bring NFTs mainstream, the partnerships that prove it's already happening, how gamers will change their tune on NFTs, and how the terminology is likely to change.

entry.title: Fordefi Aims to Dramatically Simplify the Institutional Crypto Wallet
entry.summary: Steve H., VP of sales from Fordefi, which raised $18 million in funding last year, tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA how Fordefi uses multi-party computation to make signing transactions on an institutional crypto wallet much simpler—no seed phrase needed.

entry.title: Unreleased David Bowie Recording to Debut as Music NFT
entry.summary: The never-before-heard version of Bowie's hit "Let’s Dance" will be sold via pay-what-you-want NFTs from Gala Music and benefit charity.

entry.title: Meta Launches AI Tool That Can Identify, Separate Items in Pictures
entry.summary: Meta unveils "Segment Anything" AI image identification tool, but the scale of the dataset used by the social giant raises privacy concerns.

entry.title: Dogecoin Drops Sharply After Twitter Blue Bird Returns
entry.summary: Doge had a very short run as Twitter's new mascot.

entry.title: gm: Canadian Bitcoin Miner Hut 8 Is Heading West
entry.summary: Toronto-based Bitcoin mining company Hut 8 recently announced a merger with U.S. Bitcoin Corp that will take it into Texas, Nebraska, and New York. Hut 8 CEO Jaime Leverton joined Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott to talk expanding into the U.S., dealing with regulatory pushback post-FTX, why Texas is such a hotspot, and where she'd like to expand globally down the road (the climates may surprise you). Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: ChatGPT Picks Gold Over Bitcoin, Says Crypto Critic Peter Schiff
entry.summary: ChatGPT chooses to include gold, not Bitcoin, as part of its "recession-proof" portfolio.

entry.title: gm: Kevin Owocki Wants to Regenerate DeFi
entry.summary: Move over, DeFi—ReFi is coming? Gitcoin founder Kevin Owocki has stepped away from DeFi grant-giving machine Gitcoin as it fully decentralizes and is now focused on regenerative finance (huh?) and ReFi incubator Supermodular. He aims to "regenerate the regenerators." He explained it all to Dan Roberts and Liam Kelly, and also talks DAO structure, crypto factions, NFT use cases, his book "Greenpilled," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Why Aurory's Head of Production Left Ubisoft for Web3
entry.summary: Aurory executive producer and head of production Jonathan Campeau tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about how the first-generation of Web3 games came out of DeFi and are now evolving.

entry.title: 'We Don't Really Do the Corporate Thing Very Well' Says Jason Brink on Gala Games Approach
entry.summary: With roughly 50 video games in its pipeline, Gala Games is all-in on Web3. Gala's President of Blockchain Jason Brink told Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about the studio's ethos and weighs in on the different approaches to Web3 gaming.

entry.title: gm: Coinbase's Top Lawyer Gets Real on SEC
entry.summary: Paul Grewal is the Chief Legal Officer at Coinbase and a former U.S. magistrate judge in Northern California. He gave Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott his candid takes on Sam Bankman-Fried and FTX, the SEC's crackdown on staking, the sanctioning of Tornado Cash, and more alpha on how Coinbase is approaching the current unfriendly US regulatory environment. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: The Founder of Rotten Tomatoes Says Web3 Entertainment Isn’t Nearly Entertaining Enough Yet
entry.summary: Rotten Tomatoes founder Patrick Lee, who has led companies at the intersection of technology and entertainment from Web1 to Web3, spoke to Decrypt's Sander Lutz at Outer Edge LA about the current state of decentralized gaming, film and television.

entry.title: gm: How Gnosis Has Endured and Evolved
entry.summary: Gnosis first launched in 2015 as a decentralized prediction market built on Ethereum. Now it's a DAO, a multi-sig wallet, a staking chain, and a vibrant community with its own GNO governance token. Co-founder and COO Friederike Ernst talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about the careful evolution of Gnosis, decentralization impostors, account abstraction, DeFi UX failures, why Ethereum is the "Manhattan of crypto," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Justin Aversano's Inspiration for Tarot-Themed NFT Photo Series 'Smoke and Mirrors'
entry.summary: Justin Aversano, best known for his high-selling "Twin Flames" NFT photo series, joined Decrypt’s Andrew Hayward ahead of the upcoming L.A. exhibition for his new Ethereum NFT project "Smoke and Mirrors." He shared the wild inspiration behind the tarot-themed collection, and why—despite his growing profile—he opted not to exhibit at a major brand-name gallery.

entry.title: Midnight Society’s Rob Bowling Talks Deadrop Launch and Working With Dr. Disrespect
entry.summary: Former "Call of Duty" developer Rob Bowling, now head of Midnight Society Studio, checked in with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC and shared some behind-the-scenes statistics on how players are enjoying "Deadrop." The game saw 90,000 player hours over the weekend, with 97 minutes average play time per player, and their community size tripled in just a few days.

entry.title: Big Brands Get Serious About NFTs: Salesforce, VW, Panerai, Absolute Labs at NFT Paris
entry.summary: On this panel from NFT Paris 2023 moderated by Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Web3 leads from some of the largest consumer and tech brands discuss their NFT strategies. Marc Mathieu of Salesforce, Tim Walther of VW Group, Eva Assayag of Panerai, and Samir Addamine of Absolute Labs joined the panel.

entry.title: NFT Entertainment Revolution: Warner Bros, Orange Comet, CyberBrokers and NFT Now at NFT Paris
entry.summary: At NFT Paris 2023, Decrypt’s Stephen Graves moderated a discussion about NFTs and the entertainment industry with Warner Bros’ NFT head Josh Hackbarth, CyberBrokers founder Josie Bellini, NFT Now founder Matt Medved and Dave Broome, CEO of Orange Comet, which has produced NFTs for Anthony Hopkins and The Walking Dead.

entry.title: Step Inside the Armory of the NFT Collective 'Knights Who Say Nah'
entry.summary: Knights Who Say Nah co-founder and project lead Nick Richey chats with Decrypt's Jason Nelson inside the group's armory of artifacts, shows off a historic Japanese tanto sword, and discusses why the preservation of historical artifacts is the best use case for NFTs.
